p: The reducing ability of fruit extracts was measured by the method of Benzie and Strain [ 31]. To 100 μL of extracts (2 mg/mL) and EA (1 mg/10 mL), 4.5 mL FRAP reagent (containing acetate buffer pH 3.6, 10 mM 2,4,6-tripyridyl-s-triazine (TPTZ) in 40 mM HCl, and 20 mM FeCl 3·6H 2O in the ratio of 10:1:1) was added and after 5 min absorbance was measured at 593 nm. All determinations were performed in triplicate. Calibration curve of ferrous sulfate (100−1000 μmol/l) was used, and results were expressed in μmol Fe 2+/mg dry weight of extract and calculated as mean ± standard deviation (SD).
